intro: Gonzalagunia killipii, commonly known as the Killip's gonzalagunia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high elevations. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Gonzalagunia killipii is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
